newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks off in volatile trade, NYSE sets curbs.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks off in volatile trade, NYSE sets curbs.

text.p: Wall Street stocks, after drifting in a relatively narrow range for most of the session, pushed lower as the market returned to recent volatile ways.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average took a swift downturn in early afternoon, trading down about 52 points to 7638. The New York Stock Exchange set curbs on index-arbitrage trading at 1245 EDT/1645 GMT.
The slump partly reflected weakness in bonds, which raised concerns about inflation and interest rates, traders said.
Nasdaq fell about six points to 1440 as the tech sector weakened. The long bond was off 12/32 to yield 6.77 percent.
